text:
Tomcat 3.3

Code sniplet follows:

-- begin --
<% String locale="en-us"; %>
<taglib:myTab/>
-- end --

  In the above code sniplet, taglib:myTab's pageContext.getAttribute(locale) 
will return null.. I have tried <%! .. %> style declarations as well.
creator: cowwoc@bbs.darktech.org
william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
The <% String locale="en-us" %> (or the same with <%!) only defines a scripting 
variable for the page.  If you want it to participate in the PageContext, you 
have to call pageContext.setAttribute.

creator: cowwoc@bbs.darktech.org
text:
Sorry, I was under the impression that since pageContext.setAttribute() adds 
tag-libraries into the context in the form of scripting variables, it is only 
natural for pageContext.getAttribute() to the do opposite; importing scripting 
variables to be used by JSP tags.

This is how it worked for Tomcat 3.2.3.. Could you please point me in the 
direction of any documentation which states otherwise?

PageContext's javadoc reads:
[...]
A PageContext instance provides access to all the namespaces associated with a 
JSP page
[...]

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
The <% String locale="en-us"; %> string simply embeds Java code in the JSP page.
Jasper has never parsed such Java code to determine what variables have been
declared and automatically include them as attributes in the pageContext.

I don't think the example, as specified, ever worked in Tomcat 3.2.3.  If there
is really a problem, I think a more complete example is needed.
